sen.j: 羽柴氏（はしばうじ）は、豊臣秀吉によって創始された一族。
sen.e: The Hashiba clan was the family created by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
The Hashiba clan was a clan founded by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: ①「一族」をclanへ変更、②「創始された」をfoundedへ変更しました。
sen.e: The Hashiba clan was a clan founded by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 本姓ははじめ平氏、秀吉の関白就任時には藤原氏となり、その後賜姓を受け豊臣氏となる。
sen.e: The main name changed from the Taira clan to the Fujiwara clan at the time of Hideyoshi's assumption of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and then became the Toyotomi clan due to bestowal.

Its honsei (real family name) was Taira at first, and changed to Fujiwara at the time when Hideyoshi was appointed Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), and then became Toyotomi after bestowed by the emperor.
sen.cmt: ①｢本姓」＝氏（うじ）であると解釈し、それぞれのclanを削除、②「就任する」をbe appointedに変更、③文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Its honsei (real family name) was Taira at first, and changed to Fujiwara at the time when Hideyoshi was appointed Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), and then became Toyotomi after bestowed by the emperor.

sen.j: 豊臣宗家の本来の名字でもある。
sen.e: It was also the original family name of the head family of TOYOTOMI.
It was also the original family name of the head family of TOYOTOMI.
It was also the original family name of the head family of TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: また、豊臣恩顧の大名に許された称号としての役割も果たした。
sen.e: Besides, it was the title permitted for daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) patronized by the Toyotomi family.
Besides, it served as the title given to daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who were patronized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: ①「役割を果たす」の意味を含めました。②「豊臣恩顧」の「豊臣」は秀吉を指すと思います。
sen.e: Besides, it served as the title given to daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who were patronized by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)の武将である織田信長の家臣、木下藤吉郎秀吉は戦功を上げて織田家でも有数の有力家臣となった。
sen.e: Hideyoshi Tokichiro KINOSHITA who was the vassal of Nobunaga ODA, busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period became one of the powerful vassals in the Oda family with the distinguished war service.

Hideyoshi Tokichiro KINOSHITA, who was the vassal of Nobunaga ODA, a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states), became one of the powerful vassals in the Oda family by rendering the distinguished service in war.
sen.cmt: ①必要と思われるところにコンマを入れました。②｢戦国時代」の説明を補足しました。③「戦功を挙げる」の訳を render the distinguished service in warとしました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi Tokichiro KINOSHITA, who was the vassal of Nobunaga ODA, a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states), became one of the powerful vassals in the Oda family by rendering the distinguished service in war.

sen.j: 元亀3年から天正元年までの間に秀吉は木下氏の名字を羽柴に改めた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi changed his family name from the Kinoshita clan to HASHIBA during the period from 1572 to 1573.
Hideyoshi changed his family name from Kinoshita to Hashiba during the period from 1572 to 1573.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi changed his family name from Kinoshita to Hashiba during the period from 1572 to 1573.

sen.j: 羽柴姓の残る最古の文書は離宮八幡宮文書に所収された元亀4年7月20日の秀吉発給の文書である。
sen.e: The oldest document using the family name of Hashiba was the one issued by Hideyoshi dated on August 27, 1573 collected in Rikyu Hachiman-gu Monjyo (historical documents).
The oldest document showing the family name of Hashiba was the one issued by Hideyoshi dated on August 27, 1573, collected in Rikyu Hachiman-gu Monjyo (historical documents).
sen.cmt: ①document using→showingへ変更しました。②年代1573の後にコンマを補足しました。
sen.e: The oldest document showing the family name of Hashiba was the one issued by Hideyoshi dated on August 27, 1573, collected in Rikyu Hachiman-gu Monjyo (historical documents).

sen.j: また、信長公記では元亀3年7月までの記述では木下藤吉郎であったが、9月以降の記述では「羽柴秀吉」となっている。
sen.e: Besides, 'Hideyoshi HASHIBA' was used in the descriptions after September 1572 while the name, Tokichiro KINOSHITA was used in the descriptions up to July 1572 in Shincho koki (Biography of the Warlord Oda Nobunaga).
Additionally, the name 'Tokichiro KINOSHITA' was used in Shincho koki (Biography of the Warlord Oda Nobunaga) up to July 1572, while 'Hideyoshi HASHIBA' was shown after September 1572.
sen.cmt: ①「また」＝besidesは前文で使用されているので、別の言い方に変えました。②全文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Additionally, the name 'Tokichiro KINOSHITA' was used in Shincho koki (Biography of the Warlord Oda Nobunaga) up to August 1572, while 'Hideyoshi HASHIBA' was shown after October 1572.

sen.j: 以降は秀吉の一族も羽柴を名乗るようになった。
sen.e: Thereafter, the family of Hideyoshi also called themselves HASHIBA.
Thereafter, the family of Hideyoshi also called themselves HASHIBA.
Thereafter, the family of Hideyoshi also called themselves HASHIBA.

sen.j: 『羽柴』の由来は織田家の重臣である丹羽長秀の「羽」・柴田勝家の「柴」の二つにあやかるよう付けられたとされている。
sen.e: It is said that The origin of "HASHIBA" was named after '羽' (Ha) from 丹羽長秀 (Nagahide NIWA) who was the senior vassal of the Oda family and after '柴' (Shiba) from 柴田勝家 (Katsuie SHIBATA).
It is said that "HASHIBA" was originally named after '羽' (Ha) from 丹羽長秀 (Nagahide NIWA) who was the senior vassal of the Oda family and after '柴' (Shiba) from 柴田勝家 (Katsuie SHIBATA).
sen.cmt: 原文の「由来」の訳を変え、全文の流れが自然になるようにしました。
sen.e: It is said that "HASHIBA" was originally named after '羽' (Ha) from 丹羽長秀 (Nagahide NIWA) who was the senior vassal of the Oda family and after '柴' (Shiba) from 柴田勝家 (Katsuie SHIBATA).

sen.j: この名字は信長から授けられたと見られている。
sen.e: This family name seemed to be given by Nobunaga.
This family name seemed to be given by Nobunaga.
This family name seemed to be given by Nobunaga.

sen.j: 織田信長の没後、秀吉は中央政権を掌握し、単に「秀吉」と記した書状を発給し始め「羽柴」と記した書状を発給することはなくなった。
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who seized the power in the central government after the death of Nobunaga ODA, started to issue the documents simply with signature of 'Hideyoshi', instead of issuing documents with signature of 'Hashiba'.
Hideyoshi, who seized power in the central government after the death of Nobunaga ODA, started to issue the letters simply signed by the name of 'Hideyoshi,' instead of the name of 'Hashiba.'
sen.cmt: ①「書状」をletterに変更しました。②文全体の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi, who seized power in the central government after the death of Nobunaga ODA, started to issue the letters simply signed by the name of 'Hideyoshi,' instead of the name of 'Hashiba.'

sen.j: 7月11日には近衛前久の猶子となって関白宣下を受け、天正14年（1586年）9月9日には豊臣の姓を賜った。
sen.e: After becoming an adopted child of Sakihisa KONOE and receiving imperial proclamation to become kanpaku in July 11, he was given the family name, TOYOTOMI in October 21, 1586.
After becoming an adopted child of Sakihisa KONOE and receiving an imperial proclamation to become kanpaku in July 11, he was given the family name, TOYOTOMI, in October 21, 1586.
sen.cmt: ①「7月11日」の年代は天生13年（1585年）と推定され、その場合グレゴリオ暦では1585年8月6日になりますが、原文では年代の記載がないため、そのままとしてます。②冠詞とコンマを補足しました。
sen.e: After becoming an adopted child of Sakihisa KONOE and receiving an imperial proclamation to become kanpaku in August 6, he was given the family name, TOYOTOMI, in October 21, 1586.

sen.j: 秀吉、秀頼は以降単に豊臣朝臣秀吉、もしくは豊臣朝臣秀頼と名乗り、羽柴の名字は臣下の大名が使用する称号として豊臣政権に使用され続けた。
sen.e: Thereafter, Hideyoshi and Hideyori simply called themselves TOYOTOMI no Ason Hideyoshi and TOYOTOMI no Ason Hideyori, and the family name, HASHIBA continued to be used as the title for daimyo of their vassals in Toyotomi government.

After that, Hideyoshi and Hideyori simply called themselves TOYOTOMI no Ason Hideyoshi and TOYOTOMI no Ason Hideyori, and the family name, HASHIBA, continued to be used as the title for daimyo of their vassals during the Toyotomi regime.
sen.cmt: ①「以降」の訳、thereafter が一度使用されているため別の表現としました。②コンマの補足と、「豊臣政権」の表現を変更しました。
sen.e: After that, Hideyoshi and Hideyori simply called themselves TOYOTOMI no Ason Hideyoshi and TOYOTOMI no Ason Hideyori, and the family name, HASHIBA, continued to be used as the title for daimyo of their vassals during the Toyotomi regime.

sen.j: しかし慶長20年(1615年)の大坂夏の陣で豊臣宗家が滅亡して以降は用いられなくなった。
sen.e: However, it had not been used after the destruction of the head family of TOYOTOMI in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka) in 1615.
However, it had not been used after the destruction of the head family of TOYOTOMI in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka) in 1615.
However, it had not been used after the destruction of the head family of TOYOTOMI in Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka) in 1615.

sen.j: 慶長20年（1615年）の大坂の役の際に、秀頼と国松は死亡し、大名家としての羽柴直系は断絶。
sen.e: Due to death of Hideyori and Kunimatsu in Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) in 1615, the direct line of the Hashiba family as Daimyo family was extinguished.
Due to the death of Hideyori and Kunimatsu in Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) in 1615, the direct line of the Hashiba family as Daimyo family was extinguished.
sen.cmt: deathの前に定冠詞theを補足しました。
sen.e: Due to the death of Hideyori and Kunimatsu in Osaka no Eki (The Siege of Osaka) in 1615, the direct line of the Hashiba family as Daimyo family was extinguished.

sen.j: 秀頼の娘（天秀尼）が助命されたものの正保2年（1645年）の天秀尼の死で秀吉の直系血族は断絶した。
sen.e: Though the daughter of Hideyori (Tenshu-ni) was spared, the direct family line of Hideyoshi was extinguished due to the death of Tenshu-ni in 1645.
Although the daughter of Hideyori (Tenshu-ni) was spared, the direct family line of Hideyoshi was extinguished due to the death of Tenshu-ni in 1645.
sen.cmt: thoughでも間違いではありませんが、 althoughの方が一般的だと思います。
sen.e: Although the daughter of Hideyori (Tenshu-ni) was spared, the direct family line of Hideyoshi was extinguished due to the death of Tenshu-ni in 1645.

tit.j: 羽柴の称号を与えられた大名ら
tit.e: Daimyo who were given the title, HASHIBA

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉は天正13年の関白就任時頃より、諸大名らに豊臣・羽柴の姓を与え始めた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI started to give the family names of TOYOTOMI and HASHIBA to territorial lords around when he became Kanpaku in 1585.
Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI started to give the family names of TOYOTOMI and HASHIBA to territorial lords around the time he became Kanpaku in 1585.
sen.cmt: around when→ around the timeへ変更しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI started to give the family names of TOYOTOMI and HASHIBA to territorial lords around the time he became Kanpaku in 1585.

sen.j: 二木謙一は、豊臣・羽柴の「賜姓」「授けられた」といった見方に対し、諸大名は公式には「羽柴姓」を記すことが当時の慣例であったとの推測を述べている。
sen.e: As for the view of 'shinsei' (bestowing a surname) and 'granted' in the family names of TOYOTOMI and HASHIBA, Kenichi NIKI guessed that it had been the custom for the territorial lords to write 'the family name, HASHIBA' officially at that time.

Contrary to the view of 'shinsei' (bestowing a surname) and 'granted' in the family names of TOYOTOMI and HASHIBA, Kenichi NIKI guessed that it had been the custom of the territorial lords to write 'the family name of HASHIBA' in an official manner at that time.
sen.cmt: ①「（見方）に対し」の訳をcontrary to としました。②文の流れを自然にしました。
sen.e: Contrary to the view of 'shinsei' (bestowing a surname) and 'granted' in the family names of TOYOTOMI and HASHIBA, Kenichi NIKI guessed that it had been the custom of the territorial lords to write 'the family name of HASHIBA' in an official manner at that time.
